org.domainobject.util

Class ConfigObject

  • java.lang.Object
    • org.domainobject.util.ConfigObject

  • public class ConfigObject
extends Object
    A class decorating the Properties class, providing useful extra functionality on top of it.
    Author:
    ayco

    • Nested Class Summary

      Nested Classes 
      Modifier and Type Class and Description
      static class  ConfigObject.InvalidValueException
      Exception thrown when a property's value is invalid, illegal, unexpected, etc.
      static class  ConfigObject.MissingPropertyException
      Exception thrown when a required property turns out to be missing
      static class  ConfigObject.PropertyNotSetException
      Exception when a property was expected to have a non-whitespace value, but its value did in fact only contain whitespace.

    • Constructor Summary

      Constructors 
      Constructor and Description
      ConfigObject(File propertiesFile)
      Create a ConfigObject from the specified properties file.
      ConfigObject(InputStream is)
      Create a ConfigObject from the specified InputStream.
      ConfigObject(String path)
      Create a ConfigObject from the specified file system path, supposedly pointing to a properties file.

    • Method Detail

      • isTrueValue

        public static boolean isTrueValue(String value)
        Equivalent to isTrueValue(value, false). In other words null and empty Strings are considered to be false .
        Parameters:
        value - The String to convert to a boolean
        Returns:
        See Also:
        isTrueValue(String, boolean)

      • isTrueValue

        public static boolean isTrueValue(String value,
                                  boolean dfault)
        Determines whether the specified value is a true-ish string. Returns dfault if the string is null or empty. Returns true if the specified value is "true", "1", "yes" "on" or "ok", false otherwise. The string is trimmed first and compared case-insensitively to these values.
        Parameters:
        value - The String to convert to a boolean
        dfault - The value to return if value is null or empty
        Returns:

      • isEnabled

        public static boolean isEnabled(String propName)
        Determines whether or not the specified system property has a true-ish value. If the property does not exist, false is returned.
        Parameters:
        propName - The name of the system property
        Returns:
        See Also:
        isTrueValue(String, boolean)

      • isEnabled

        public static boolean isEnabled(Properties config,
                                String propName)
        Determines if the specified property in the specified Properties object has a true-ish value. If the property does not exist, false is returned.
        Parameters:
        config - The Properties object
        propName - The name of the property
        Returns:

      • isEnabled

        public static boolean isEnabled(String propName,
                                boolean dfault)
        Determines whether or not the specified system property has a true-ish value. If the property does not exist, dfault is returned.
        Parameters:
        propName - The name of the property
        dfault - The value to return if the property does not exist or is an empty string
        Returns:
        See Also:

        public Properties getProperties()

      • get

        public String get(String property)
        Get the value of the specified property. Equivalent to get(property, null, true). This method behaves differently than Properties.getProperty(). The latter method returns null if the property does not exist and an empty string if it does, but is not set. This method, on the other hand, returns null in both cases. To get the same behaviour as Properties.getProperty() use get(String, boolean).
        Parameters:
        property -
        Returns:

      • get

        public String get(String property,
                  String dfault)
        Get the value of the specified property. Equivalent to get(property, dfault, true).
        Parameters:
        property -
        dfault -
        Returns:

                  boolean emptyIsNull)

        Parameters:

        emptyIsNull -
        Returns:
        See Also:
        get(String, String, boolean)

      • get

        public String get(String property,
                  String dfault,
                  boolean emptyIsDefault)
        Get the value of the specified property.
        Parameters:
        property - The property whose value to get
        dfault - The value to return if the property does not exist
        emptyIsDefault - Whether or not to return the default value dfault if the property is present but its value is an empty string
        Returns:
        The value of the property

      • getInt

        public int getInt(String property)
        Get the value of the specified integer property. If the property does not exist, 0 (zero) is returned.
        Parameters:
        property - The property to look up
        Returns:
        The value of the property

        Get the value of the specified boolean property.
        Parameters:

      • isTrue

        public boolean isTrue(String property,
                      boolean dfault)
        Get the value of the specified boolean property.
        Parameters:
        property - The property to look up
        dfault - The value to return if the property does not exist or is an empty string.
        Returns:
        See Also:
        isTrueValue(String, boolean), isEnabled(Properties, String, boolean)

      • required

        public String required(String property)
        Get the value of the specified property. The property is assumed to be a required property (it must exist and have a non-whitespace value). If the property does not exist a ConfigObject.MissingPropertyException is thrown. If its value contains only whitespace, a ConfigObject.PropertyNotSetException is thrown.
        Parameters:
        property - The property to look up
        Returns:
        The value of the specified property
        Throws:
        ConfigObject.MissingPropertyException - If the specified property does not exist
        ConfigObject.PropertyNotSetException - If the value of the property contains only whitespace

      • required

        public <T> T required(String property,
                      Class<T> castTo)
        Get the value of the specified property, cast to the specified type. Allowed types are: all primitive types, all primitive wrappers, and String. The property is assumed to be a required property (it must exist and have a non-whitespace value). If the property does not exist a ConfigObject.MissingPropertyException is thrown. If its value contains only whitespace, a ConfigObject.PropertyNotSetException is thrown.
        Parameters:
        property -
        castTo - The class to cast the property's value to.
        Returns:

      • getFile

        public File getFile(String property)
        Get a File instance corresponding to the specified property. If the property does not point to an existing regular file, an ConfigObject.InvalidValueException is thrown. The property is assumed to be a required property (it must exist and have a non-whitespace value). If the property does not exist a ConfigObject.MissingPropertyException is thrown. If its value contains only whitespace, a ConfigObject.PropertyNotSetException is thrown.
        Parameters:
        property - The path of the file
        Returns:
        A File object corresponding to the path

      • getDirectory

        public File getDirectory(String property)
        Get a File instance corresponding to the specified property. If the property does not point to an existing directory, an ConfigObject.InvalidValueException is thrown. The property is assumed to be a required property (it must exist and have a non-whitespace value). If the property does not exist a ConfigObject.MissingPropertyException is thrown. If its value contains only whitespace, a ConfigObject.PropertyNotSetException is thrown.
        Parameters:
        property -
        Returns:

      • getPath

        public Path getPath(String property)
        Get a Path instance corresponding to the specified property. If the property does not point to an existing file or directory, an ConfigObject.InvalidValueException is thrown. The property is assumed to be a required property (it must exist and have a non-whitespace value). If the property does not exist a ConfigObject.MissingPropertyException is thrown. If its value contains only whitespace, a ConfigObject.PropertyNotSetException is thrown.
        Parameters:
        property -
        Returns:

      • set

        public void set(String property,
                String value)
        Set the value of the specified property.
        Parameters:
        property - The property to set
        value - The value to set it to
